title: AFL Trades 2019: Brad Hill Fremantle, St Kilda negotiations
text:
AFL: Geelong list manager Stephen Wells says his side is satisfied with the deal they got for Tim Kelly.

Trade negotiations between St Kilda and Fremantle are reportedly on the verge of falling apart.

A report claims the two clubs are still miles apart as the Saints continue to try and find a way to secure a trade for star Freo midfielder Brad Hill.

Fox Footy’s Tom Morris reports Fremantle has been outflanked in negotiations by St Kilda’s big pick swap trade with the GWS Giants on Thursday.

The deal has seen the Saints receive the Giants’ No. 12 and No. 18 picks at this year’s draft, while the western Sydney club receives picks No. 6 and No. 59.

The swap came after reports emerged that Fremantle had demanded two first round picks for Hill, reportedly demanding the Saints’ No. 6 pick and its first round pick at the 2020 draft.

The Saints deal with the Giants could now see them walk away from talks with Fremantle, or potentially try and secure a deal with just the No. 12 pick the club received from the Giants.

Morris reports the swap “gobsmacked” rival recruitment bosses.

“No more than an hour after it was revealed Fremantle was after two first round selections for Hill — who last month nominated Moorabbin as his preferred destination — GWS and St Kilda formally executed the trade, leaving the Dockers for dead,” Morris reported.

“Foxfooty.com.au understands Fremantle footy boss Peter Bell had canvassed external opinions in recent weeks regarding Hill’s trade value, but his ploy to ask for more prompted the Saints to move ahead with different deals and effectively leave Fremantle behind.

“Recruiters from rival clubs were understood to be gobsmacked by the trade, largely because next generation academy prospect Liam Henry is a good chance to be bid on in the top 10, which would eliminate the Dockers next selection (Pick 12, if attained from the Saints).

“In short, Fremantle would not be able to get Henry and also use Picks 12 and 18 from the Saints.”

The report claims the pick swap will allow the Saints to pull off its deals for Zak Jones, Dougal Howard and Paddy Ryder.

The Saints are reportedly also determined to hold onto their first round pick at the 2020 draft in a bid to poach Gold Coast emerging star Ben King in 12 months time.

Hill is still contracted at Fremantle for a further two seasons.

Hill last month officially requested a trade back to Victoria.

One of the league’s best runners, Hill enjoyed a stellar season playing on the wing for the Dockers but he’s one of the biggest names on the trade block.

His name has been linked with several clubs, but it’s St Kilda who look to be leading the race to secure him with rumours he’s chasing $900,000 a year.

Former Hawthorn captain Shane Crawford believes he’d completely change the way the Saints would play for the better.

“He is a bit of a genius. The thing is, he might give you 25 touches and he uses the ball really well, but what he does with his gut running, he pushes so hard that it opens up all the defence,” Crawford told SEN Breakfast.

“All of a sudden they have to open up and be very cautious of someone running towards the goals.
description: Trade negotiations between St Kilda and Fremantle are reportedly on the verge of falling apart.
